titleStmt.title: D. S. Colyer, B. K. Bethurum, and Daniel Roberts, Affidavit
CWG2892

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Rockcastle County sct.

We D T Colyer clerk B K Bethurum Judge & Daniel Roberts Sheriff Duly Authorized to compare the poll books for An Election held in said county Do certify that at an Election held in Said county on the 4th day of August 1862 Jesse Lair was Duly Elected to fill the office of Justice of the peace in District No 2
Given under our hand this the 7th day of August 1862.

D S Colyer clerk
B K Bethurum Judge
Daniel Roberts S R C

A copy attest
W M Fish clerk Rockcastle county Kentucky

Rockcastle Co
Dist No 2
J. P.
Com Issd Nov 25. 1862

Frankfer Ky
To Secretary of State
